Harnack's inequality

Let Ω⊆C\Omega \subseteq \CΩ⊆C be open, bounded, and simply connected. Let uuu be harmonic in Ω\OmegaΩ and assume that u≥0u \geq 0u≥0. Show the following: for each compact set K⊆ΩK \subseteq \OmegaK⊆Ω, there exists a constant CK>0C_K > 0CK​>0 such that

sup⁡x∈Ku(x)≤CKinf⁡x∈Ku(x).\sup_{x \in K} u\p{x} \leq C_K \inf_{x \in K} u\p{x}.x∈Ksup​u(x)≤CK​x∈Kinf​u(x).
Solution.

First, we will show that we can replace KKK with a connected compact set. Let δ=12d(K,Ωc)>0\delta = \frac{1}{2}d\p{K, \Omega^\comp} > 0δ=21​d(K,Ωc)>0 and for each z∈Kz \in Kz∈K, notice that B(z,δ)⊆ΩB\p{z, \delta} \subseteq \OmegaB(z,δ)⊆Ω. By compactness, there exist finitely many balls which cover KKK, and this cover has finitely many connected components (since there are only finitely many balls). Thus, replacing KKK with the closure of these balls, we may assume without loss of generality that KKK has finitely many connected components. Since Ω\OmegaΩ is (path) connected, we can connect these components with finitely many curves. Replacing KKK with KKK union these curves, we may thus assume without loss of generality that KKK is a connected compact set.

For each z∈Kz \in Kz∈K, let Rz>0R_z > 0Rz​>0 be such that B(z,2Rz)‾⊆Ω\cl{B\p{z, 2R_z}} \subseteq \OmegaB(z,2Rz​)​⊆Ω. By compactness, there exist z1,…,zNz_1, \ldots, z_Nz1​,…,zN​ such that {B(zn,Rn)}n\set{B\p{z_n, R_n}}_n{B(zn​,Rn​)}n​ cover KKK. Fix a z0∈Kz_0 \in Kz0​∈K. For any z∈Kz \in Kz∈K, path connectedness of KKK gives γ\gammaγ such that γ(0)=z0\gamma\p{0} = z_0γ(0)=z0​ and γ(1)=z\gamma\p{1} = zγ(1)=z, and so we get a sequence {B(znk,Rnk)}1≤k≤M\set{B\p{z_{n_k}, R_{n_k}}}_{1 \leq k \leq M}{B(znk​​,Rnk​​)}1≤k≤M​ such that z0∈B(zn0,Rn0)z_0 \in B\p{z_{n_0}, R_{n_0}}z0​∈B(zn0​​,Rn0​​), z∈B(znM,RnM)z \in B\p{z_{n_M}, R_{n_M}}z∈B(znM​​,RnM​​), and B(znk,Rnk)∩B(znk+1,Rnk+1)≠∅B\p{z_{n_k}, R_{n_k}} \cap B\p{z_{n_{k+1}}, R_{n_{k+1}}} \neq \emptysetB(znk​​,Rnk​​)∩B(znk+1​​,Rnk+1​​)=∅. We may remove duplicates without breaking this property, so we have a strict subset of AAA.

Notice that if w∈B(znk,Rnk)∩B(znk+1,Rnk+1)w \in B\p{z_{n_k}, R_{n_k}} \cap B\p{z_{n_{k+1}}, R_{n_{k+1}}}w∈B(znk​​,Rnk​​)∩B(znk+1​​,Rnk+1​​), then Harnack's inequality gives

13u(znk)=2Rnk−Rnk2Rnk+Rnku(znk)≤u(w),u(w)≤2Rnk+Rnk2Rnk−Rnku(znk)=3u(znk+1),\begin{gathered} \frac{1}{3}u\p{z_{n_k}} = \frac{2R_{n_k} - R_{n_k}}{2R_{n_k} + R_{n_k}} u\p{z_{n_k}} \leq u\p{w}, \\ u\p{w} \leq \frac{2R_{n_k} + R_{n_k}}{2R_{n_k} - R_{n_k}} u\p{z_{n_k}} = 3u\p{z_{n_{k+1}}}, \end{gathered}31​u(znk​​)=2Rnk​​+Rnk​​2Rnk​​−Rnk​​​u(znk​​)≤u(w),u(w)≤2Rnk​​−Rnk​​2Rnk​​+Rnk​​​u(znk​​)=3u(znk+1​​),​

so u(znk)≤9u(znk+1)u\p{z_{n_k}} \leq 9u\p{z_{n_{k+1}}}u(znk​​)≤9u(znk+1​​). Hence, by induction, we see

u(z)≤3⋅9Mu(z0)≤3⋅9Nu(z0).u\p{z} \leq 3 \cdot 9^M u\p{z_0} \leq 3 \cdot 9^N u\p{z_0}.u(z)≤3⋅9Mu(z0​)≤3⋅9Nu(z0​).

Let CK=3⋅9NC_K = 3 \cdot 9^NCK​=3⋅9N. Since zzz was arbitrary, we see

sup⁡z∈Ku(z)≤CKu(z0).\sup_{z \in K} u\p{z} \leq C_K u\p{z_0}.z∈Ksup​u(z)≤CK​u(z0​).

Similarly, z0z_0z0​ was arbitrary, so

sup⁡z∈Ku(z)≤CKinf⁡z∈Ku(z).\sup_{z \in K} u\p{z} \leq C_K \inf_{z \in K} u\p{z}.z∈Ksup​u(z)≤CK​z∈Kinf​u(z).
